run_specs.comment_case_name: case_name should be the base name of the case. For example, if you have oneD_channel_with_bump_SIF.dat or oneD_channel_with_bump.srhhydro as the control file, the case_name should be oneD_channel_with_bump.
run_specs.comment_sampled_parameters_file: The name of the file containing the sampled parameters generated by the preprocess_SRH_2D_Monte_Carlo.py script.
run_specs.comment_ManningN_MaterialIDs: The ID of the Manning's n zones whose n values are changed in the Monte Carlo simulations. Note: In SRH-2D, the ID is 1-based. If the Manning's n zone is not to be changed, it should be set to -1 or simply not specified.
run_specs.comment_Q_bc_ID: The ID of the inlet-q boundary conditions (1-based). If the inlet-q boundary is not to be changed, it should be set to -1 or simply not specified.
run_specs.comment_WSE_bc_ID: The ID of the exit-h boundary condition (1-based). If the exit-h boundary is not to be changed, it should be set to -1 or simply not specified.
run_specs.comment_bDeleteCaseDir: Whether to delete the Monte Carlo cases after simulation is done
run_specs.comment_bParallel: Whether to run the Monte Carlo simulations in parallel
run_specs.comment_nProcess: The number of cores to use for the parallel Monte Carlo simulations (if bParallel is true)
run_specs.comment_output_unit: The unit of the simulation output from SRH-2D; EN: English units, SI: SI units
